fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.examples.molene.controllers

Class ControllerModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.Model
      • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.AtomicModel
        • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.examples.molene.controllers.ControllerModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VariableDefinitionsAndSharingI, VariableInitialisationI, AtomicModelI, EventsExchangingI, ModelI, java.io.Serializable

    @ModelExternalEvents(imported={BatteryLevel.class,WiFiBandwidthReading.class},
                     exported={Compressing.class,NotCompressing.class,LowBattery.class})
public class ControllerModel
extends AtomicModel
    The class ControllerModel defines a common model between the portable computer controller and the server controller.

    Description

    The controller model has three states: compressing, not compressing and low battery level. It imports two types of events providing bandwidth measurements and battery level measurements. Given the received values, it triggers decisions to go to not compressing and compressing or to go to the low battery state. These decisions are exported as three types of events.

    Because in the DEVS protocol, the processing of an external event cannot trigger the issuing of an external event, the above behaviour is implemented through three steps:

    1. when an external event, battery reading or bandwidth reading, is received and processed, if it must trigger a mode change for the system, the new decision is computed ans put in the variable triggeredDecision and then the boolean variable mustTransmitDecision is put at true;
    2. when the mustTransmitDecision is true, the method timeAdvance returns a 0 time delay until the next internal transition;
    3. the triggered internal transition first requires a call to the method output, which emits the decision event;
    4. the internal transition is then executed and toggles mustTransmitDecision back to false.
    • Imported events: BatteryLevel, WiFiBandwidthReading
    • Exported events: Compressing, NotCompressing, LowBattery

    Invariant

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2018-10-09

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

      • setSimulationRunParameters

        public void setSimulationRunParameters(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> simParams)
                                throws MissingRunParameterException
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        set the simulation parameters for a simulation run.

        Description

        This method is the same as fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.simulators.interfaces.SimulationManagementI#setSimulationRunParameters(java.util.Map). It could be factored out in a separate interface, but maybe a too complicated solution for just one method.

        Contract

         pre     simParams != null && simParams.size() > 0
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        simParams - map from parameters names to their values.
        Throws:
        MissingRunParameterException - if an expected run parameter does not appear in simParams (including simParams being null).
        See Also:
        ModelI.setSimulationRunParameters(Map)

      • initialiseState

        public void initialiseState(Time initialTime)
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        initialise the state of the model to make it ready to execute a simulation run.

        Description

        The standard predefined state initialisation will set the time to the next event. Hence, if a specific model has to perform some initialisations which the first internal transition depends upon, it must first perform them and then call the inherited method using super.

        Contract

         pre     initialTime != null
 pre     initialTime.greaterThanOrEqual(Time.zero(getSimulatedTimeUnit()))
 post    isInitialised()
        Specified by:
        initialiseState in interface ModelI
        Overrides:
        initialiseState in class AtomicModel
        Parameters:
        initialTime - time of the simulation when it will start.
        See Also:
        AtomicModel.initialiseState(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Time)

      • output

        public java.util.ArrayList<EventI> output()
        Description copied from interface: AtomicModelI
        maps the current internal state to the output set; this method is user-model-dependent hence must be implemented by the user for atomic models.

        Description

        Beware that when this method is called, though the simulation time has conceptually reached the time if the next internal event, the value returned by getCurrentStateTime has not yet been updated to that time. Hence the actual current simulation time is given by this.getCurrentStateTime().add(this.getNextTimeAdvance()).

        Contract

         pre     isInitialised()
 pre     getNextTimeAdvance().lessThan(Duration.INFINITY)
 pre     getNextTimeAdvance().equals(getTimeOfNextEvent().subtract(getCurrentStateTime()))
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Returns:
        the corresponding external events or null if none.
        See Also:
        AtomicModelI.output()

 post    true        // no postcondition.

      • userDefinedExternalTransition

        public void userDefinedExternalTransition(Duration elapsedTime)
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        do an external transition using a previously stored external input event; this method is user-model-dependent hence must be implemented by the user for atomic models; the user implementation should not change any of the implementation related variables.

        Description

        The current simulation time when this method is called can be accessed by calling the method getCurrentStateTime.

        Contract

         pre     isInitialised()
 pre     elapsedTime != null
 pre     elapsedTime.lessThanOrEqual(getNextTimeAdvance())
 pre     getCurrentStateTime().lessThanOrEqual(getTimeOfNextEvent())
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Specified by:
        userDefinedExternalTransition in interface ModelI
        Overrides:
        userDefinedExternalTransition in class AtomicModel
        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - simulation time since the last processed event.
        See Also:
        AtomicModel.userDefinedExternalTransition(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Duration)

      • endSimulation

        public void endSimulation(Time endTime)
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        terminate the current simulation.

        Description

        This method can be user-defined, allowing to perform some catering work like gathering data or computing statistics that depends upon the end time of the simulation (and that would likely be included in the simulation report of the model).

        Contract

         pre     endTime != null
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Parameters:

        See Also:
